detailedRequirements:
Welcome to the CrowdReason - Engrafa Service Enhancements Challenge.  This challenge is part of the CrowdReason Engrafa project.

Overview

The Engrafa Service helps clients extract highly confident, structured data from PDF documents. Instead of using OCR, the service crowdsources the data extraction.  The Engrafa Service acts as a Workflow Manager to automate the process of sending PDFs through segmented jobs and aggregating the results into a complete data set.

Presently, the service monitors an online cloud storage for new documents to process.  Then each document goes through a series of worker tasks to determine or verify details about the document.  The Engrafa Service accumulates each response and by the end of the workflow, key data has been extrapolated from the PDF.

For this challenge, we have a list of improvements for the existing service.  We’re looking to you to help update our solution to fit our new workflow, and to improve the functionality of the service.

Detailed Requirements

Configuration File (insert.js)

  1. Update the service to support entry conditions at the task level (currently, this is only supported at the group level).

  2. Update the configuration to support a streamlined workflow file for complex dependencies.  Current implementation requires multiple groups per phase to support complex entry conditions (see current insert.js).  We would like to have one group per phase instead (see target-insert-expert.js for example).

  3. Update the service to support multiple workflow configurations.

    1. Currently, we run insert.js to add the configuration to the database for the service.  If we want to change this configuration, it’s recommended to drop the database so that you can insert a new configuration.

    2. We’d like to support multiple configurations.  For example, I run insert.js now and start running the service.  A few documents get started in the workflow. Then I want to make a change to the workflow configuration.  I update the config and want any new docs to follow the new workflow; previous documents already in progress should continue to use the original workflow.

  4. Add support to specify “input” fields at the task level.  These will be field names collected from previous tasks.  Currently we send ALL evaluationContext properties, and this is overkill.

    1. E.g. “input” : [“validstate”, “state”, “collectorname”] or something similar.

  5. Add support to transform output at task level.

    1. Example use case is we might collect a field “pobox” as a number (e.g. { “pobox”: 514 }).  Instead of a number output field, we might want to transform this to a separate new field, appended to some default text, e.g. “address1”: “PO Box 514”.

    2. Add some way to be able to specify output transformation, e.g. pobox -> address1 as “PO Box “ + pobox.value.

  6. Allow Taxonomy properties to be used in entry conditions for the workflow configuration (both at task level and group level), in addition to current support for previously gathered document data.  This would be used for the Extraction task group.  For example: taxonomy.hasaccountnumber == “No” and taxonomy.paymentschedule = “one”

Output File

  1. Update output.xml to include which job a value came from (e.g. <field name=”state” value=”WA” jobname=”CLASSIFICATION_STATE_BASIC”/>)

Bug Fixes

  1. A valid refresh token is not always retrieved. Our access tokens expire after an hour for our online cloud storage.  Upon starting the EngrafaServiceApp, the service successfully gets an updated refresh_token.  However, if the service runs for hours, it sometimes doesn’t get a new refresh_token and fails to post items back to the online storage.  We get the error “Invalid access token” but no attempt is made to refresh the token.

  2. Remove files from “public” folder after moved to the “output” folder.

  3. Update log management so we’re not building one long log file.  Also make sure exceptions are included (some exceptions appear to only be thrown to the console and not the logs).

Technology Overview

  • Node.js

  • MongoDB
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Submission Deliverables

  • Source Code - Zip of source files.

  • Documentation - Provide documentation of setup (install/config) and steps for using the app.

  • Video - Video demonstrating setup of app (install + config), demo of app functionality, and overview of code.
